column5: Got a surprise message.  Heading to Great Bear Lake. Been told they have Grayling. Any chance you could tie up some last minute bead head flys ?  He sent me a post from the Outfitter on what was a common tie for up there.  I came up with some variant beaded Nats and Hares ears which were on the list,but he was happy with the out come and I sent them off to him this morning. Looking forward to pics when he returns.   I,ll be on the local streams Friday, fishing for browns.

I'm surprised he wasn't looking for any dry flies....Grayling readily sip bugs from the surface, and of course so much fun watching them inhale it. A Black Gnat is a "go to" up north of 60.. Nice work on the bead heads !
Black Gnat is my favorite, especially for Brown Trout and Grayling.
Send him a couple of your pike dragons, and watch a forty pound laker come up from behind the grayling and smash it!Â  ðŸ˜‰
